page.title: 15BROADWAY IN THE FIFTIES (1)
page.content: We have been talking to Mrs.P.Hooper and she has lived in Broadway for 35 years since the 1950's.She has told us about life in the 1950's.Nowadays some people use the bus service but many now have a car.Only three Broadway families had cars in the 1950's. Today children go to a new primary school,in Broadway and then to the Comprehensive school in Chard.In the 1950's the primary school was in Broadway but the children went to a Secondary Modern or a Grammar School in Ilmiinster. The village has grown there were two lots of council houses in 1950's but there were no private estates.Also there were no houses up Pound Road and up Brookside.
